requirements.summary: Add a proposal-only redesign document that re-evaluates Onebit from zero while preserving the core goal and overall session journey shape, and commits to deterministic-only “AI-like” behavior plus wellness/burnout support.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/REDESIGN_PROPOSAL.md` exists and is written in English.
The proposal explicitly states this is a proposal-only deliverable (no implementation yet).
The proposal re-evaluates the product from zero (does not assume current features are kept) while keeping the same Onebit goal and the same overall session journey shape.
The proposal explicitly commits to deterministic-only behavior (no external LLM / no web AI integrations) while still aiming for “AI-like” richness via rules, heuristics, and structured inputs.

file_operations.description: Create an English, proposal-only redesign document that rethinks Onebit from scratch while preserving the core goal and session format, and outlines an expanded set of deterministic (rule-based) “AI-like” capabilities plus wellness/burnout/overwhelm support for user approval prior to any implementation.

requirements.summary: Specify the redesigned end-to-end UX flow with one primary decision per screen, using both free text and structured inputs, and detailing deterministic adaptation for stuck/overwhelmed/burned out states.
acceptanceCriteria: The proposal defines the redesigned screens/steps and keeps “one primary decision per screen” as a guiding principle.
For each step, the proposal specifies: inputs (text + structured), deterministic processing, and user-facing outputs/copy tone guidelines (calm, respectful, non-gamified).

The proposal includes a deterministic model for: (a) richer suggestions, (b) adaptive fallback tasks, (c) stuck detection signals, (d) dynamic micro-step selection/generation rules, and (e) improved understanding of user input using combined text + structured signals.

The proposal defines explicit burnout/overwhelm handling: detection signals, recovery pathways, and “focus on the next one thing today” guidance, including normalization of failure and try-again paths.

file_operations.description: Add an end-to-end UX specification section that enumerates each redesigned screen/step (purpose, one primary decision, required inputs including both free text and structured fields, deterministic processing rules/heuristics, and user-facing outputs/copy tone). Include explicit deterministic adaptation paths for stuck/overwhelmed/burned out states, including detection signals, recovery pathways, and try-again guidance.

requirements.summary: Add a feature inventory decision table that re-evaluates current Onebit features from zero and explicitly removes Demo Mode / “Try Demo” and the three canned demo sessions from the intended experience, with high-level backend implications noted.
acceptanceCriteria: The proposal includes a table that lists the existing features (e.g., demo mode, history, reflections, admin panel, accessibility controls, optional sync/auth) and indicates Keep/Modify/Remove/Postpone for each with one-sentence rationale.
Demo Mode / “Try Demo” is explicitly marked as Remove, with a short note describing what replaces its value (if anything) without adding new external integrations.
The proposal identifies any backend implications at a high level (data model needs, endpoints needed, migration risk), but does not require implementation yet.

file_operations.description: Add a feature inventory decision table that reconsiders all current features from zero and marks each as Keep/Modify/Remove/Postpone with one-sentence rationale. Explicitly mark Demo Mode / “Try Demo” and the 3 canned demo sessions as Remove, and include a brief deterministic replacement for their value (if any). Add a short high-level section listing backend implications (capability needs, migration risk) without requiring implementation.
